intro: Scurrula buddleioides var. heynei, commonly known as the Heyne's scurrula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for both ornamental gardening and ecological studies.
